title: The Causes And Effects Of Today's Inflation, With Raghuram Rajan
description: The Federal Reserve is likely to hike interest rates in March due to high inflation and the strong labor market. But where did this inflation come from? Is it transitory or is it here to stay? Whom does it hurt the most and what should be done about it? To discuss this, we invited Chicago Booth professor and former IMF chief economist Raghuram Rajan, who – when he served as India’s central banker – was charged with fighting inflation himself.
author: uchicagopodcasts@gmail.com (University of Chicago Podcast Network)
